round_best: Develop an adaptive OOD detection system that utilizes a hybrid approach combining self-supervised learning with real-time anomaly scoring based on adversarial training. The system employs generative adversarial networks (GANs) where the generator attempts to simulate near-distribution scenarios while the discriminator progressively learns to identify subtle deviations from normal operations. This dynamic interplay allows the system to continually refine its understanding of "normal" and "abnormal," effectively adapting to new, unseen out-of-distribution data without the need for labeled data, thereby enhancing reliability in changing operational environments.
